item.title: Honoring the citizen-soldiers of the National Guard of the State of Pennsylvania, including the 56th Brigade Combat Team (Stryker) of the Pennsylvania Army National Guard on its return to the United States from deployment in Iraq.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Personnel.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Armed Services. (text of measure as introduced: CR S10992-10993)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S10993)

summary.text:
Expresses gratitude to the members of the Army National Guard and Air National Guard of Pennsylvania and their families for their service and sacrifice on behalf of the United States.

Commends the members of the 56th Brigade Combat Team (Stryker) of the Pennsylvania Army National Guard on the completion of their deployment to Iraq.

Recognizes that Team's achievements, as well as all other formerly and presently deployed Pennsylvania Army and Air National Guard units and members, for their exemplary service.

bill.title: A resolution commending the service of the 56th Stryker Brigade Combat Team of the Pennsylvania Army National Guard.

item.title: A resolution commending the service of the 56th Stryker Brigade Combat Team of the Pennsylvania Army National Guard.
A resolution commending the service of the 56th Stryker Brigade Combat Team of the Pennsylvania Army National Guard.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Armed Services. (text of measure as introduced: CR S10992-10993)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
